result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry R. Pinedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerry R. Pinedo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerry R. Pinedo was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Jerry R. Pinedo was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc. [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).
  • Jerry R. Pinedo was found guilty of Attempt Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Jerry R. Pinedo was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 16 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Beth Cano, or any adult women, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Not to enter into a living relationship with another woman unless approved by agent.  No violations of restraining order.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Beth C or any other person prohibited by the agent, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Deft may have contact with Tina M when in prison setting; during extended supervision it is up to the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No relationships with women other than approved by the agent.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lambrechts.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court amends order that the deft may have contact with Tina M. when in prison setting; during extended supervision it is up to the agent.
Handwritten credit calculation.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lambrechts.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 8 years WSP:  5 years initial confinement w/credit for 221 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 4 the court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP consecutive to ct 1:  5 years initial confinement; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 7 the court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP concurrent to ct 1:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 221 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 8 the court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP concurrent to cts 1 & 7:  1 year initial confinement w/credit for 221 days served; 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP.  No contact with Beth C. or Tina M. or any other person prohibited by agent.  No relationships with women other than approved by the agent.
With Atty Lambrechs and Amy/ADA Drees the SEHR of 3/31/17 at 9:30am is rescheduled, as the deft was not writted from Dodge Correctional; reset to 4/11/17 at 8:30am.
With Atty Lambrechts the SEHR of 3/22/17 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Lambrechts has a conflict; reset to 3/31/17 at 9:30am.
Revocation packet.
At the request of DOC Agt Patricia Bey a SEHR is set for 3/22/17 at 1:15pm.
Dated 5/19/16 - IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to June 16, 2016.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1, 4, 7 & 8; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $750 DNA surcharge; credit for 16 days served if revoked.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3, 5, 6, 9-32 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1, 4, 7 & 8.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1, 4, 7 & 8.  State is not in victim compliance to proceed to sentencing today.  SEH set for 11/19/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
Per ADA Delgado and Atty Caspari the case is resovled, therefore the JS of 11/16/15 at 8:30am is changed to a PLEAH.
